meanings.definition: To remove the mast or masts from (a ship).
meanings.sent1: The sailors demasted the ship before the storm.
meanings.sent2: The crew demasted the old vessel for repairs.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight to see the sailors demasted the ship in record time.
meanings.sent4: The decision to demast the ship left it vulnerable in the rough seas.
meanings.sent5: The loud creaking as they demasted the ship echoed across the harbor.

meanings.definition: Having had the mast or masts removed.
meanings.sent1: The demasted ship sailed smoothly without its mast.
meanings.sent2: The demasted vessel looked incomplete without its mast.
meanings.sent3: The demasted ship seemed oddly lighter without the mast.
meanings.sent4: The demasted boat stood out among the others in the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The demasted ship stood silently in the calm waters, a shadow of its former self.
